label: 木端
本: The Lumber Industry in Early Modern Japan . University of Hawai'i Press . 1995
説明文: Lead crew of eight or sixtten men (one or two labor gangs or kumi) that laid out the timber chute, building it downhill length by length for a total of 80 to 250 feet.  At its food they arranged other pieces to form a log catchment (p. 60).  [Also 木鼻]
